oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-05-05 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 5, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ferlin Husky (host/performer), guest performers Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles, and regular performers Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers, Del Wood, Rod Brasfield, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ferlin Husky; Claude Sharpe; Old Hickory Singers; Bill Carlisle; Carlisles; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ferlin Husky -- Aladdin's Lamp (Ferlin Husky) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ferlin Husky) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers -- In A Little Red Barn (Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ferlin Husky) -- Ferlin Husky introduces the Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles -- Goo-Goo Da Da (Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles) -- Ferlin Husky talks -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- Ferlin Husky talks -- Peace In The Valley (Ferlin Husky) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ferlin Husky) -- Prince Albert jingle (Ferlin Husky) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Del Wood -- Just Because (Del Wood)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Old Hickory Singers; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; Husky, Ferlin; Carlisle, Bill; Carlisles (Musical group)
